newsitem.title: CHINA: Delphi sets up $18 mln car parts firm in China.
newsitem.headline: Delphi sets up $18 mln car parts firm in China.

text.p: Ohio-based Delphi Packard Electric Systems, a unit of U.S. carmaker General Motors Corp, has set up a $18 million company in south China to make automobile parts and systems, the China Daily said on Tuesday.
"Our products will be exported to Europe and gradually sold in the domestic market," the newspaper quoted Norbert Geisinger, president of Delphi Packard Electric System, as saying.
The new company, wholly owned by Delphi Packard Electric, is to begin operation in mid-1997, with annual production capacity of 250,000 automobile systems, the newspaper said.

It covers an area of 12,300 sq metres (132,400 sq ft) in the east district of the Guangzhou Economic and Technological Development Zone in Guangzhou city, capital of Guangdong province, the newspaper said.
Delphi has 11 joint ventures producing automobile systems, parts, batteries and electronics in China.
